verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Command the children of Israel, that they put out of the camp every leper, and every one that hath an issue, and whosoever is defiled by the dead:
verses.web: “Command the children of Israel that they put out of the camp every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever is unclean by a corpse.
verses.ct: "Give this command to the Israelites: They must send away from the camp anyone with a skin disease, anyone with a bodily discharge, and anyone who has become unclean by touching a dead body.

verses.kjv: Both male and female shall ye put out, without the camp shall ye put them; that they defile not their camps, in the midst whereof I dwell.
verses.web: You shall put both male and female outside of the camp so that they don’t defile their camp, in the midst of which I dwell.”
verses.ct: Send them all outside the camp — both men and women — so they don't make the camp unclean, because I live among them."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did so, and put them out without the camp: as the LORD spake unto Moses, so did the children of Israel.
verses.web: The children of Israel did so, and put them outside of the camp; as LORD spoke to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
verses.ct: The Israelites obeyed. They sent these people outside the camp, exactly as the LORD had told Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, When a man or woman shall commit any sin that men commit, to do a trespass against the LORD, and that person be guilty;
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel: ‘When a man or woman commits any sin that men commit, so as to trespass against LORD, and that soul is guilty,
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: When a man or woman wrongs another person in any way, that person has sinned against the LORD and is guilty.

verses.kjv: Then they shall confess their sin which they have done: and he shall recompense his trespass with the principal thereof, and add unto it the fifth part thereof, and give it unto him against whom he hath trespassed.
verses.web: then he shall confess his sin which he has done; and he shall make restitution for his guilt in full, add to it the fifth part of it, and give it to him in respect of whom he has been guilty.
verses.ct: They must confess the sin they committed, then pay back the full amount they owe plus an additional 5th of its value, giving it to the person they wronged.

verses.kjv: But if the man have no kinsman to recompense the trespass unto, let the trespass be recompensed unto the LORD, even to the priest; beside the ram of the atonement, whereby an atonement shall be made for him.
verses.web: But if the man has no kinsman to whom restitution may be made for the guilt, the restitution for guilt which is made to LORD shall be the priest’s, in addition to the ram of the atonement, by which atonement shall be made for him.
verses.ct: But if that person has died and has no relative to receive the payment, the restitution belongs to the LORD and goes to the priest — in addition to the ram of atonement, through which atonement is made for the guilty person.

verses.kjv: And every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring unto the priest, shall be his.
verses.web: Every heave offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they present to the priest, shall be his.
verses.ct: Every sacred offering that the Israelites bring to the priest will belong to him.

verses.kjv: And every man’s hallowed things shall be his: whatsoever any man giveth the priest, it shall be his.
verses.web: Every man’s holy things shall be his; whatever any man gives the priest, it shall be his.’ ”
verses.ct: Each person's sacred gifts are their own to give, but whatever someone gives to the priest becomes the priest's."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man’s wife go aside, and commit a trespass against him,
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
verses.ct: "Tell the Israelites: Suppose a man's wife turns unfaithful and sins against him.

verses.kjv: And a man lie with her carnally, and it be hid from the eyes of her husband, and be kept close, and she be defiled, and there be no witness against her, neither she be taken with the manner;
verses.web: and a man lies with her carnally, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband and this is kept concealed, and she is defiled, there is no witness against her, and she isn’t taken in the act;
verses.ct: Another man sleeps with her, but it's kept secret from her husband. She has been defiled, yet there are no witnesses and she wasn't caught in the act.

verses.kjv: And the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be defiled: or if the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be not defiled:
verses.web: and the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife and she is defiled; or if the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife and she isn’t defiled;
verses.ct: If a spirit of jealousy comes over the husband and he suspects his wife — whether she has actually been unfaithful or not —

verses.kjv: Then shall the man bring his wife unto the priest, and he shall bring her offering for her, the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal; he shall pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon; for it is an offering of jealousy, an offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
verses.web: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest, and shall bring her offering for her: one tenth of an ephah of barley meal. He shall pour no oil on it, nor put frankincense on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to memory.
verses.ct: he must bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring an offering on her behalf: a 10th of an ephah of barley meal. He must not pour oil on it or add frankincense, because this is a jealousy offering — a memorial offering meant to bring the truth about wrongdoing to light.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall bring her near, and set her before the LORD:
verses.web: The priest shall bring her near, and set her before LORD.
verses.ct: The priest will bring the woman forward and have her stand before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel; and of the dust that is in the floor of the tabernacle the priest shall take, and put it into the water:
verses.web: The priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel; and the priest shall take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
verses.ct: Then the priest will take holy water in a clay jar and mix in some dust from the floor of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall set the woman before the LORD, and uncover the woman’s head, and put the offering of memorial in her hands, which is the jealousy offering: and the priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that causeth the curse:
verses.web: The priest shall set the woman before LORD, and let the hair of the woman’s head go loose, and put the meal offering of memorial in her hands, which is the meal offering of jealousy. The priest shall have in his hand the water of bitterness that brings a curse.
verses.ct: The priest will have the woman stand before the LORD, let her hair hang loose, and place the memorial offering — the jealousy offering — in her hands. The priest himself will hold the bitter water that brings a curse.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall charge her by an oath, and say unto the woman, If no man have lain with thee, and if thou hast not gone aside to uncleanness with another instead of thy husband, be thou free from this bitter water that causeth the curse:
verses.web: The priest shall cause her to take an oath and shall tell the woman, “If no man has lain with you, and if you haven’t gone aside to uncleanness, being under your husband’s authority, be free from this water of bitterness that brings a curse.
verses.ct: Then the priest will put her under oath and say to her, "If no man has slept with you, and if you have not been unfaithful to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse do you no harm.

verses.kjv: But if thou hast gone aside to another instead of thy husband, and if thou be defiled, and some man have lain with thee beside thine husband:
verses.web: But if you have gone astray, being under your husband’s authority, and if you are defiled, and some man has lain with you besides your husband—”
verses.ct: But if you have been unfaithful to your husband and have let another man sleep with you —"

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest shall say unto the woman, The LORD make thee a curse and an oath among thy people, when the LORD doth make thy thigh to rot, and thy belly to swell;
verses.web: then the priest shall cause the woman to swear with the oath of cursing, and the priest shall tell the woman, “May LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people, when LORD allows your thigh to fall away, and your body to swell;
verses.ct: At this point the priest will put the woman under a sworn curse, saying to her, "May the LORD make you an example of cursing among your people. May the LORD cause your thigh to waste away and your abdomen to swell.

verses.kjv: And this water that causeth the curse shall go into thy bowels, to make thy belly to swell, and thy thigh to rot: And the woman shall say, Amen, amen.
verses.web: and this water that brings a curse will go into your bowels, and make your body swell, and your thigh fall away.” The woman shall say, “Amen, Amen.”
verses.ct: May this water that brings a curse enter your body, making your abdomen swell and your thigh waste away." The woman must respond, "Amen, amen."

verses.kjv: And the priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall blot them out with the bitter water:
verses.web: “ ‘The priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall wipe them into the water of bitterness.
verses.ct: The priest will write these curses on a scroll and then wash the words off into the bitter water.

verses.kjv: And he shall cause the woman to drink the bitter water that causeth the curse: and the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, and become bitter.
verses.web: He shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that causes the curse; and the water that causes the curse shall enter into her and become bitter.
verses.ct: He will make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water will enter her body and turn bitter inside her.

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall take the jealousy offering out of the woman’s hand, and shall wave the offering before the LORD, and offer it upon the altar:
verses.web: The priest shall take the meal offering of jealousy out of the woman’s hand, and shall wave the meal offering before LORD, and bring it to the altar.
verses.ct: The priest will take the jealousy offering from the woman's hands, wave it before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take an handful of the offering, even the memorial thereof, and burn it upon the altar, and afterward shall cause the woman to drink the water.
verses.web: The priest shall take a handful of the meal offering, as its memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, and afterward shall make the woman drink the water.
verses.ct: The priest will take a handful of the offering as the memorial portion and burn it on the altar. After that, he will have the woman drink the water.

verses.kjv: And when he hath made her to drink the water, then it shall come to pass, that, if she be defiled, and have done trespass against her husband, that the water that causeth the curse shall enter into her, and become bitter, and her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall rot: and the woman shall be a curse among her people.
verses.web: When he has made her drink the water, then it shall happen, if she is defiled and has committed a trespass against her husband, that the water that causes the curse will enter into her and become bitter, and her body will swell, and her thigh will fall away; and the woman will be a curse among her people.
verses.ct: Once she drinks the water, if she has been unfaithful and sinned against her husband, the curse-bringing water will enter her and turn bitter — her abdomen will swell and her thigh will waste away. She will become an example of cursing among her people.

verses.kjv: And if the woman be not defiled, but be clean; then she shall be free, and shall conceive seed.
verses.web: If the woman isn’t defiled, but is clean; then she shall be free, and shall conceive offspring.
verses.ct: But if the woman has not been unfaithful and is clean, she will be cleared of guilt and will be able to become pregnant.

verses.kjv: This is the law of jealousies, when a wife goeth aside to another instead of her husband, and is defiled;
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of jealousy, when a wife, being under her husband, goes astray, and is defiled,
verses.ct: This is the law for cases of jealousy — when a wife has been unfaithful to her husband and has been defiled,

verses.kjv: Or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon him, and he be jealous over his wife, and shall set the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute upon her all this law.
verses.web: or when the spirit of jealousy comes on a man, and he is jealous of his wife; then he shall set the woman before LORD, and the priest shall execute on her all this law.
verses.ct: or when a spirit of jealousy comes over a husband and he suspects his wife. He must bring her before the LORD, and the priest must carry out this entire procedure.

verses.kjv: Then shall the man be guiltless from iniquity, and this woman shall bear her iniquity.
verses.web: The man shall be free from iniquity, and that woman shall bear her iniquity.’ ”
verses.ct: The husband will be free from guilt, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin."
